Problem:
Consider a system governed by the complex function \\(z(t) = Ce^{i\\omega t}\\), where \\(C\\) and \\(\\omega\\) are constants. We explore the effect of applying a linear transformation \\(T(z) = Az + B\\) at time \\(t = 0\\), where \\(A\\) and \\(B\\) are complex constants.

Given only the final state \\(z(T)\\), can we retroactively determine \\(z_0\\) without knowing if \\(T(z)\\) was applied at \\(t = 0\\)?
Explanation: Without explicit knowledge of the application of \\(T(z)\\), there are infinitely many possibilities for \\(z_0\\) based on different potential choices of \\(A\\) and \\(B\\). The transformation \\(Az + B\\) could have configured any number of initial states to reach the same \\(z(T)\\), especially given the non-invertibility when \\(A = 0\\).
